result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Dewayne Horton

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint PreTrial Services DISCHARGE Report dated 10/17/2022; received and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Dewayne Horton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Kenneth Dewayne Horton.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas for Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant has new charges in Ozaukee county. Defense requested adjournment; Court granted one more adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36. Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Kenneth Dewayne Horton in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and an offer.  Defense requests a status date to allow additional time for review with client.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-5-22
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Dewayne Horton in court in person with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke who appears by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.   
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Kenneth Dewayne Horton not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defendant is in custody in Kenosha County, not produced. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kenneth Dewayne Horton in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Kenneth Dewayne Horton in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Dewayne Horton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
